column4: Funny thing... I was an early adaptor. 1982... bought a TI/99. Went through a ton of over priced toys... c-64, amiga, apple... loved apple os 7. Finally settled into windows 3.1. geez... I'm old!!!
My son has infected his AND my PC's with CWS highjacks. I'm ready to divorce Mr. Gates.
I used Windows until May of this year, but I've always had a healthy distrust of most of those "free" "helpful" addons... :P
recip - I've just got my Private, still working toward IFR/Comm
you've been flying just a bit longer than I have, then :)
I planning on flying for a living - and as for sanity, holding a PL & being sane seem to be mutually exclusive
actually, I'm breaking the 8hr bottle-to-throttle rule as we speak, so no post-takeoff checklist for me! :P
at this point it's kind of irrelavent for me. I've flown professionally for 30 years. Suddenly I'm medically grounded. So... my AME tells me to keep my mind active. I've decided to learn linux. ;)
good for you - too bad about the medical - hope you get it back soon!
the great secret of aviation - aircraft are actually powered by paperwork, not by avgas or JetA... :P
I think you've been here before - welcome back
they're useful, got lots of apps & such in them
be glad automatix didn't just break everything for you...
I do - I think I've seen you here before, too
